page.title: 16GOREY VILLAGE
page.content:
{Gorric}is an old spelling of Gorey. In Norman Times Gorey was probably an {administrative centre}for the area in which it is situated. In 1978 the villagers' homes were badly flooded and, as result, in 1979 drainage was laid under the golf-links of the Jersey Golf Club. In the 1980's the drainage scheme had to be extended as floods had hit the area again.
It was as a result of the important {oyster fishing}industry that houses were built in Gorey to accomodate the employees of the industry and in 1832 {Gouray Church}was built. The village has recently been enlarged to provide lower priced housing for Jersey families. This development received a Civic Trust Award in May 1985.
